trans-unit.source: Connect a web app to an API app in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Connect a web app to an API app in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to consume an API app from an ASP.NET web app hosted in Azure App Service.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to consume an API app from an ASP.NET web app hosted in Azure App Service.

trans-unit.source: Connect a web app to an API app in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Connect a web app to an API app in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows how to consume an API app from an ASP.NET web app hosted in <link><linkText>App Service</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows how to consume an API app from an ASP.NET web app hosted in <link><linkText>App Service</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: This tutorial builds upon the series from the API App tutorials:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial builds upon the series from the API App tutorials:

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Create an Azure API App</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Create an Azure API App</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Deploy an Azure API App</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Deploy an Azure API App</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Debug an Azure API App</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Debug an Azure API App</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: Make the API app publicly accessible
trans-unit.target: Make the API app publicly accessible

trans-unit.source: In the <link><linkText>Azure preview portal</linkText><title></title></link>, select the API app.
trans-unit.target: In the <link><linkText>Azure preview portal</linkText><title></title></link>, select the API app.

trans-unit.source: Click on the Settings button in the command bar.
trans-unit.target: Click on the Settings button in the command bar.

trans-unit.source: In the Application Settings blade, change the Access Level to Public (anonymous).
trans-unit.target: In the Application Settings blade, change the Access Level to Public (anonymous).

trans-unit.source: Create an ASP.NET MVC Application in Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Create an ASP.NET MVC Application in Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: Open Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: Open Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Use the New Project dialogue to add a new ASP.NET Web Application.
trans-unit.target: Use the New Project dialogue to add a new ASP.NET Web Application.

trans-unit.source: Click OK.
trans-unit.target: Click OK.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>File > New > Web > ASP.NET Web Application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>File > New > Web > ASP.NET Web Application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select the MVC template.
trans-unit.target: Select the MVC template.

trans-unit.source: Click Change Authentication, then select No Authentication, and then click OK twice.
trans-unit.target: Click Change Authentication, then select No Authentication, and then click OK twice.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New ASP.NET Application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New ASP.NET Application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, right-click the newly created Web Application project and select Add Azure App Reference.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, right-click the newly created Web Application project and select Add Azure App Reference.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add Azure API App Reference...</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add Azure API App Reference...</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Existing API Apps dropdown list, select the API App you would like to connect to.
trans-unit.target: In the Existing API Apps dropdown list, select the API App you would like to connect to.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Select Existing API App</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Select Existing API App</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The client code for connecting to the API app will be automatically generated from a Swagger API endpoint.
trans-unit.target: The client code for connecting to the API app will be automatically generated from a Swagger API endpoint.

trans-unit.source: To leverage the generated API code, open the HomeController.cs file and replace the Contact action with the following:
trans-unit.target: To leverage the generated API code, open the HomeController.cs file and replace the Contact action with the following:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>HomeController.cs Code Updates</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>HomeController.cs Code Updates</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Update the Contact view to reflect the dynamic list of contacts with the code below:
trans-unit.target: Update the Contact view to reflect the dynamic list of contacts with the code below:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Contact.cshtml Code Updates</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Contact.cshtml Code Updates</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Deploy the web application to Web Apps in App Service
trans-unit.target: Deploy the web application to Web Apps in App Service

trans-unit.source: Follow the instructions available at <link><linkText>How to Deploy an Azure web app</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Follow the instructions available at <link><linkText>How to Deploy an Azure web app</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to <link><linkText>Try App Service</linkText><title></title></link>, where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.
trans-unit.target: If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to <link><linkText>Try App Service</linkText><title></title></link>, where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.

trans-unit.source: No credit cards required; no commitments.
trans-unit.target: No credit cards required; no commitments.

trans-unit.source: What's changed
trans-unit.target: What's changed

trans-unit.source: For a guide to the change from Websites to App Service see: <link><linkText>Azure App Service and Its Impact on Existing Azure Services</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: For a guide to the change from Websites to App Service see: <link><linkText>Azure App Service and Its Impact on Existing Azure Services</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: For a guide to the change of the old portal to the new portal see: <link><linkText>Reference for navigating the preview portal</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: For a guide to the change of the old portal to the new portal see: <link><linkText>Reference for navigating the preview portal</linkText><title></title></link>
